New Records: The Mets became the first team since the 2002 Angels to avoid striking out in a postseason game.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run homer in the first inning
Starling Marte had four hits, three of which were doubles
Jesse Winker had two hits, including an RBI triple
Francisco Alvarez had three hits, including a double
Ryne Stanek and Edwin Díaz combined for the final thirteen outs of the game
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets were down three games to one in the NLCS and needed a win to stay alive
The team was facing Jack Flaherty and the Dodgers pitching staff
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets' performance allowed fans to dream on another improbable comeback from the team
Alonso demonstrated his elite power with his first-inning homer
Marte's big night at the plate came after making a trade with a young fan
Alvarez has turned it around in a big way over the past two games
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Temptations performed 'My Girl' before the game
Francisco Lindor was loving the performance
The game was a 12-6 victory for the Mets
The Mets will have a decision to make next season on whether to use José Buttó as a starter or reliever
Brett Baty is hoping that some adjustments he made in the minor leagues will allow him to get his big league career back on track
